title: Timetable changes on the Cranbourne Line
articleContent:
More train services coming to Cranbourne

Passengers on the Cranbourne Line will benefit from more trains, more often, with 50 extra services per week from Sunday 13 February 2022.

The new timetable will see 30 peak services extended from Westall or Dandenong to Cranbourne each week, giving passengers more choice during busy times.

Another 20 daytime services will be extended to and from Cranbourne while five non-peak services will be extended to Pakenham each week.

An extra 524 services will stop at Malvern Station each week as part of the changes to give passengers more options.

These changes are thanks to work on the Cranbourne Line Upgrade, which has finished a year ahead of schedule.

The changes include 8km of new duplicated track between Dandenong and Cranbourne, eliminating bottlenecks and allowing trains to run every 10 minutes on average in the morning peak.

Check the new Cranbourne and Pakenham timetables or plan ahead using Journey planner.

Gippsland Line timetable changes

Those travelling on V/Line Gippsland Line services will experience a +1-minute journey time change and changes to departure times at Southern Cross and Richmond to accommodate Metro trains stopping at Malvern.

Check the new Traralgon and Bairnsdale V/Line timetables or plan ahead using Journey planner.

Please note: There will be temporary timetables in place from Monday 14 February to Wednesday 9 March on the Gippsland Line following track works on the line. To view or download the tempoary timetables, see Gippsland Line temporary timetables.

Bus and coach timetable changes

The timetable for a number of buses and coaches will change to maintain reliable connections with the adjusted train timetable along the Cranbourne Line and Gippsland.

To check if your service is affected and check the new timetables, visit Timetable adjustments for improved travel on the Cranbourne Line.
